Apple__Apple_scab: Apple scab is a disease caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis. It affects the leaves and fruit of apple trees, causing dark, scabby lesions.
Apple_Black_rot: Black rot of apple is caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa. It leads to fruit rot, leaf spot, and canker diseases in apple trees.
Apple_Cedar_apple_rust: Cedar-apple rust is a disease caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae. It affects apple trees and cedar trees alternately.
Apple_healthy: The apple tree is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Blueberry_healthy: The blueberry plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Cherry(including_sour)__Powdery_mildew: Powdery mildew on cherry is caused by the fungus Podosphaera clandestina. It appears as a white powdery growth on leaves and shoots.
Cherry(including_sour)__healthy: The cherry plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Corn(maize)__Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_l: Gray leaf spot of maize is caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis. It causes gray, rectangular lesions on leaves.
Corn(maize)__Common_rust: Common rust of maize is caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi. It produces reddish-brown pustules on leaves.
Corn_(maize)__Northern_Leaf_Blight: Northern leaf blight of maize is caused by the fungus Exserohilum turcicum. It creates long, elliptical gray-green lesions on leaves.
Corn(maize)__healthy: The maize plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Grape_Black_rot: Black rot of grape is caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii. It results in black lesions on leaves and fruit.
Grape_Esca(Black_Measles): Esca (Black Measles) of grape is a complex disease caused by several fungi. It causes leaf striping and black lesions on berries.
Grape__Leaf_blight(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot): Leaf blight of grape is caused by the fungus Pseudopezicula tracheiphila. It leads to brown lesions on leaves.
Grape__healthy: The grapevine is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Orange_Haunglongbing(Citrus_greening): Huanglongbing, also known as citrus greening, is caused by the bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter asiaticus. It results in yellowing leaves and misshapen fruit.
Peach__Bacterial_spot: Bacterial spot of peach is caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni. It results in water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit.
Peach_healthy: The peach tree is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Pepper,_bell_Bacterial_spot: Bacterial spot of bell pepper is caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria. It results in water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit.
Pepper,_bell_healthy: The bell pepper plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Potato_Early_blight: Early blight of potato is caused by the fungus Alternaria solani. It causes dark, concentric lesions on leaves.
Potato_Late_blight: Late blight of potato is caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans. It results in water-soaked lesions that turn brown and necrotic.
Potato_healthy: The potato plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Raspberry_healthy: The raspberry plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Soybean_healthy: The soybean plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Squash_Powdery_mildew: Powdery mildew of squash is caused by several fungi, including Erysiphe cichoracearum. It appears as white powdery spots on leaves.
Strawberry_Leaf_scorch: Leaf scorch of strawberry is caused by the fungus Diplocarpon earlianum. It results in irregular, dark brown spots on leaves.
Strawberry_healthy: The strawberry plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot: Bacterial spot of tomato is caused by Xanthomonas spp. It results in water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit.
Tomato_Early_blight: Early blight of tomato is caused by the fungus Alternaria solani. It creates concentric rings on leaves and fruit.
Tomato_Late_blight: Late blight of tomato is caused by Phytophthora infestans. It leads to water-soaked, dark lesions on leaves and fruit.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold: Leaf mold of tomato is caused by the fungus Passalora fulva. It results in yellow spots on leaves that turn brown.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot: Septoria leaf spot of tomato is caused by Septoria lycopersici. It produces small, circular lesions with dark borders.
Tomato_Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_m: Two-spotted spider mite (Tetranychus urticae) infestation causes stippling and webbing on tomato leaves.
Tomato_Target_Spot: Target spot of tomato is caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola. It leads to brown, target-like spots on leaves.
Tomato_Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV) causes yellowing and curling of leaves, and stunted growth in tomato plants.
Tomato_Tomato_mosaic_virus: Tomato mosaic virus (ToMV) results in mottled, dark green and light green leaves, and reduced fruit yield.
Tomato__healthy: The tomato plant is healthy with no visible signs of disease.
